snippet.title: Police apply for fresh AVO against Salim Mehajer for estranged wife
snippet.content:
NSW police interview Salim Mehajer 0:49
Salim Mehajer emerges following a night spent in police cells after allegedly assaulting a taxi driver.
April 2nd 2017 4 months ago /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Network News/National/
Fresh AVO application: Salim Mehajer. Picture: AAP/Brendan Esposito
Share
THERE'S more trouble for embattled former Auburn councillor Salim Mehajer, with police to apply for a fresh apprehended violence order against him on behalf of his estranged wife Aysha. It's the latest court battle for the property developer and former local councillor, who first came to wide attention when he wed his .
Bitter split: Salim Mehajer and his wife Aysha on their wedding day. Picture: SuppliedSource:Facebook NSW Police confirmed on Tuesday a new application for an AVO would be made on August 9 in Sutherland Local Court, The pair married in an which shut down a street in 2015, and the August 9 court date is less than a week short of when they would have celebrated their second wedding anniversary.
Salim and Aysha Learmonth: The pair split last year after less than a year of marriage. Picture: SuppliedSource:Supplied But they split last year, with police , preventing him from contacting or approaching her. Mr Mehajer is currently embroiled in a series of court battles, . Two businesses this year.
Aysha Learmonth. Picture: InstagramSource:Instagram
